en: Now that you've settled on what you want to say, another idea strikes you. Should you memorize your points? After all, you don't want your eyes glued to a piece of paper, or even bouncing up and down. You've been told eye contact is essential.
Memorizing the speech would help you maintain eye contact, and you'd still have paper in case you get lost.
You memorize what you want to say and feel pretty confident you've got it all down. No eyes glued to the paper for you!
There's no need to forcibly memorize it. After enough practice, you'll basically have it memorized, anyways. That time is better spent on other things.
